member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.ALIGN_UNDEFINED
member.summary: A possible value for paragraph Element. This specifies that the text is aligned to the left indent and extra whitespace should be placed on the right.

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.ALIGN_LEFT
member.summary: A possible value for paragraph Element. This specifies that the text is aligned to the left indent and extra whitespace should be placed on the right.

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.ALIGN_CENTER
member.summary: A possible value for paragraph Element. This specifies that the text is aligned to the center and extra whitespace should be placed equally on the left and right.

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.ALIGN_RIGHT
member.summary: A possible value for paragraph Element. This specifies that the text is aligned to the right indent and extra whitespace should be placed on the left.

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.ALIGN_JUSTIFIED
member.summary: A possible value for paragraph Element. This specifies that extra whitespace should be spread out through the rows of the paragraph with the text lined up with the left and right indent except on the last line which should be aligned to the left.

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.ALIGN_TOP
member.summary: A possible value for vertical Element.

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.ALIGN_MIDDLE
member.summary: A possible value for vertical Element.

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.ALIGN_BOTTOM
member.summary: A possible value for vertical Element.

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.ALIGN_BASELINE
member.summary: A possible value for vertical Element.

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.ALIGN_JUSTIFIED_ALL
member.summary: Does the same as ALIGN_JUSTIFIED but the last line is also spread out.

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.CCITTG4
member.summary: Pure two-dimensional encoding (Group 4)

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.CCITTG3_1D
member.summary: Pure one-dimensional encoding (Group 3, 1-D)

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.CCITTG3_2D
member.summary: Mixed one- and two-dimensional encoding (Group 3, 2-D)

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.CCITT_BLACKIS1
member.summary: A flag indicating whether 1-bits are to be interpreted as black pixels and 0-bits as white pixels,

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.CCITT_ENCODEDBYTEALIGN
member.summary: A flag indicating whether the filter expects extra 0-bits before each encoded line so that the line begins on a byte boundary.

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.CCITT_ENDOFLINE
member.summary: A flag indicating whether end-of-line bit patterns are required to be present in the encoding.

member.name: F:iTextSharp.text.Element.CCITT_ENDOFBLOCK
member.summary: A flag indicating whether the filter expects the encoded data to be terminated by an end-of-block pattern, overriding the Rows parameter. The use of this flag will set the key /EndOfBlock to false.

Constructs a TIFFDirectory from a SeekableStream. The directory parameter specifies which directory to read from the linked list present in the stream; directory 0 is normally read but it is possible to store multiple images in a single TIFF file by maintaing multiple directories.
@param stream a SeekableStream to read from. @param directory the index of the directory to read.
Returns the number of directory entries.
Returns the value of a given tag as a TIFFField, or null if the tag is not present.
Returns true if a tag appears in the directory.
Returns an ordered array of ints indicating the tag values.
Returns an array of TIFFFields containing all the fields in this directory.
Returns the value of a particular index of a given tag as a byte. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the tag is present and has type TIFFField.TIFF_SBYTE, TIFF_BYTE, or TIFF_UNDEFINED.
Returns the value of index 0 of a given tag as a byte. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the tag is present and has type TIFFField.TIFF_SBYTE, TIFF_BYTE, or TIFF_UNDEFINED.

Returns the value of a particular index of a given tag as a long. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the tag is present and has type TIFF_BYTE, TIFF_SBYTE, TIFF_UNDEFINED, TIFF_SHORT, TIFF_SSHORT, TIFF_SLONG or TIFF_LONG.

Returns the value of index 0 of a given tag as a long. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the tag is present and has type TIFF_BYTE, TIFF_SBYTE, TIFF_UNDEFINED, TIFF_SHORT, TIFF_SSHORT, TIFF_SLONG or TIFF_LONG.
Returns the value of a particular index of a given tag as a float. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the tag is present and has numeric type (all but TIFF_UNDEFINED and TIFF_ASCII).
Returns the value of index 0 of a given tag as a float. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the tag is present and has numeric type (all but TIFF_UNDEFINED and TIFF_ASCII).
Returns the value of a particular index of a given tag as a double. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the tag is present and has numeric type (all but TIFF_UNDEFINED and TIFF_ASCII).
Returns the value of index 0 of a given tag as a double. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the tag is present and has numeric type (all but TIFF_UNDEFINED and TIFF_ASCII).
Returns the number of image directories (subimages) stored in a given TIFF file, represented by a SeekableStream.
Returns a bool indicating whether the byte order used in the the TIFF file is big-endian (i.e. whether the byte order is from the most significant to the least significant)
Returns the offset of the IFD corresponding to this TIFFDirectory.
Returns the offset of the next IFD after the IFD corresponding to this TIFFDirectory.
Flag for pairs of 32 bit unsigned integers.
Flag for pairs of 32 bit signed integers.
The number of data items present in the field.
Returns the tag number, between 0 and 65535.
Returns the type of the data stored in the IFD. For a TIFF6.0 file, the value will equal one of the TIFF_ constants defined in this class. For future revisions of TIFF, higher values are possible.
Returns the number of elements in the IFD.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.TryUnfilter
member.summary: Tries the unfilter the bytes of the stream. If the stream is filtered and PDFsharp knows the filter algorithm, the stream content is replaced by its unfiltered value and the function return true. Otherwise the content keeps untouched and the function returns flase. The funktion is useful for analysing existing PDF files.

member.summary: Common keys for all streams.

member.summary: Base class for all dictionary Keys classes.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.Length
member.summary: (Required) The number of bytes from the beginning of the line following the keyword stream to the last byte just before the keywordendstream. (There may be an additional EOL marker, preceding endstream, that is not included in the count and is not logically part of the stream data.)

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.Filter
member.summary: (Optional) The name of a filter to be applied in processing the stream data found between the keywords stream and endstream, or an array of such names. Multiple filters should be specified in the order in which they are to be applied.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.DecodeParms
member.summary: (Optional) A parameter dictionary or an array of such dictionaries, used by the filters specified by Filter. If there is only one filter and that filter has parameters, DecodeParms must be set to the filter�s parameter dictionary unless all the filter�s parameters have their default values, in which case the DecodeParms entry may be omitted. If there are multiple filters and any of the filters has parameters set to nondefault values, DecodeParms must be an array with one entry for each filter: either the parameter dictionary for that filter, or the null object if that filter has no parameters (or if all of its parameters have their default values). If none of the filters have parameters, or if all their parameters have default values, the DecodeParms entry may be omitted.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.F
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) The file containing the stream data. If this entry is present, the bytes between stream and endstream are ignored, the filters are specified by FFilter rather than Filter, and the filter parameters are specified by FDecodeParms rather than DecodeParms. However, the Length entry should still specify the number of those bytes. (Usually, there are no bytes and Length is 0.)

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.FFilter
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) The name of a filter to be applied in processing the data found in the stream�s external file, or an array of such names. The same rules apply as for Filter.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.FDecodeParms
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) A parameter dictionary, or an array of such dictionaries, used by the filters specified by FFilter. The same rules apply as for DecodeParms.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.DL
member.summary: Optional; PDF 1.5) A non-negative integer representing the number of bytes in the decoded (defiltered) stream. It can be used to determine, for example, whether enough disk space is available to write a stream to a file. This value should be considered a hint only; for some stream filters, it may not be possible to determine this value precisely.

member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.summary: Gets the underlying XImage object.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys
member.summary: Common keys for all streams.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be XObject for an image XObject.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Subtype
member.summary: (Required) The type of XObject that this dictionary describes; must be Image for an image XObject.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Width
member.summary: (Required) The width of the image, in samples.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Height
member.summary: (Required) The height of the image, in samples.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.ColorSpace
member.summary: (Required for images, except those that use the JPXDecode filter; not allowed for image masks) The color space in which image samples are specified; it can be any type of color space except Pattern. If the image uses the JPXDecode filter, this entry is optional: • If ColorSpace is present, any color space specifications in the JPEG2000 data are ignored. • If ColorSpace is absent, the color space specifications in the JPEG2000 data are used. The Decode array is also ignored unless ImageMask is true.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.BitsPerComponent
member.summary: (Required except for image masks and images that use the JPXDecode filter) The number of bits used to represent each color component. Only a single value may be specified; the number of bits is the same for all color components. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, 8, and (in PDF 1.5) 16. If ImageMask is true, this entry is optional, and if specified, its value must be 1. If the image stream uses a filter, the value of BitsPerComponent must be consistent with the size of the data samples that the filter delivers. In particular, a CCITTFaxDecode or JBIG2Decode filter always delivers 1-bit samples, a RunLengthDecode or DCTDecode filter delivers 8-bit samples, and an LZWDecode or FlateDecode filter delivers samples of a specified size if a predictor function is used. If the image stream uses the JPXDecode filter, this entry is optional and ignored if present. The bit depth is determined in the process of decoding the JPEG2000 image.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Intent
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) The name of a color rendering intent to be used in rendering the image. Default value: the current rendering intent in the graphics state.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.ImageMask
member.summary: (Optional) A flag indicating whether the image is to be treated as an image mask. If this flag is true, the value of BitsPerComponent must be 1 and Mask and ColorSpace should not be specified; unmasked areas are painted using the current nonstroking color. Default value: false.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Mask
member.summary: (Optional except for image masks; not allowed for image masks; PDF 1.3) An image XObject defining an image mask to be applied to this image, or an array specifying a range of colors to be applied to it as a color key mask. If ImageMask is true, this entry must not be present.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Decode
member.summary: (Optional) An array of numbers describing how to map image samples into the range of values appropriate for the image’s color space. If ImageMask is true, the array must be either [0 1] or [1 0]; otherwise, its length must be twice the number of color components required by ColorSpace. If the image uses the JPXDecode filter and ImageMask is false, Decode is ignored. Default value: see “Decode Arrays”.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Interpolate
member.summary: (Optional) A flag indicating whether image interpolation is to be performed. Default value: false.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Alternates
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) An array of alternate image dictionaries for this image. The order of elements within the array has no significance. This entry may not be present in an image XObject that is itself an alternate image.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.SMask
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A subsidiary image XObject defining a soft-mask image to be used as a source of mask shape or mask opacity values in the transparent imaging model. The alpha source parameter in the graphics state determines whether the mask values are interpreted as shape or opacity. If present, this entry overrides the current soft mask in the graphics state, as well as the image’s Mask entry, if any. (However, the other transparencyrelated graphics state parameters—blend mode and alpha constant—remain in effect.) If SMask is absent, the image has no associated soft mask (although the current soft mask in the graphics state may still apply).

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.SMaskInData
member.summary: (Optional for images that use the JPXDecode filter, meaningless otherwise; PDF 1.5) A code specifying how soft-mask information encoded with image samples should be used: 0 If present, encoded soft-mask image information should be ignored. 1 The image’s data stream includes encoded soft-mask values. An application can create a soft-mask image from the information to be used as a source of mask shape or mask opacity in the transparency imaging model. 2 The image’s data stream includes color channels that have been preblended with a background; the image data also includes an opacity channel. An application can create a soft-mask image with a Matte entry from the opacity channel information to be used as a source of mask shape or mask opacity in the transparency model. If this entry has a nonzero value, SMask should not be specified. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Name
member.summary: (Required in PDF 1.0; optional otherwise) The name by which this image XObject is referenced in the XObject subdictionary of the current resource dictionary.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.StructParent
member.summary: (Required if the image is a structural content item; PDF 1.3) The integer key of the image’s entry in the structural parent tree.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.ID
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3; indirect reference preferred) The digital identifier of the image’s parent Web Capture content set.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.OPI
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) An OPI version dictionary for the image. If ImageMask is true, this entry is ignored.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Metadata
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A metadata stream containing metadata for the image.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.OC
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) An optional content group or optional content membership dictionary, specifying the optional content properties for this image XObject. Before the image is processed, its visibility is determined based on this entry. If it is determined to be invisible, the entire image is skipped, as if there were no Do operator to invoke it.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngChunkTypes
member.summary: Contains a list of possible chunk type identifier.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngChunkTypes.Header
member.summary: The first chunk in a png file. Can only exists once. Contains common information like the width and the height of the image or the used compression method.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngChunkTypes.Palette
member.summary: The PLTE chunk contains from 1 to 256 palette entries, each a three byte series in the RGB format.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngChunkTypes.Data
member.summary: The IDAT chunk contains the actual image data. The image can contains more than one chunk of this type. All chunks together are the whole image.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngChunkTypes.End
member.summary: This chunk must appear last. It marks the end of the PNG datastream. The chunk's data field is empty.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngChunkTypes.PaletteAlpha
member.summary: This chunk specifies that the image uses simple transparency: either alpha values associated with palette entries (for indexed-color images) or a single transparent color (for grayscale and truecolor images).

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngChunkTypes.Text
member.summary: Textual information that the encoder wishes to record with the image can be stored in tEXt chunks. Each tEXt chunk contains a keyword and a text string.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngChunkTypes.Gamma
member.summary: Thes chunk specifies the relationship between the image samples and the desired display output intensity.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngChunk
member.summary: Stores header information about a chunk.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngChunk.Length
member.summary: An unsigned integer giving the number of bytes in the chunk's data field. The length counts only the data field, not itself, the chunk type code, or the CRC. Zero is a valid length

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngChunk.Type
member.summary: A chunk type as string with 4 chars.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngChunk.Data
member.summary: The data bytes appropriate to the chunk type, if any. This field can be of zero length.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngChunk.Crc
member.summary: A CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) calculated on the preceding bytes in the chunk, including the chunk type code and chunk data fields, but not including the length field. The CRC is always present, even for chunks containing no data

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngDecoder
member.summary: Encoder for generating a image out of a png stream.
member.remarks:
At the moment the following features are supported:
Filters: all filters are supported.
Pixel formats:
RGB (Truecolor) with alpha (8 bit).
RGB (Truecolor) without alpha (8 bit).
Greyscale with alpha (8 bit).
Greyscale without alpha (8 bit).
Palette Index with alpha (8 bit).
Palette Index without alpha (8 bit).

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngHeader
member.summary: Represents the png header chunk.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngHeader.Width
member.summary: The dimension in x-direction of the image in pixels.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngHeader.Height
member.summary: The dimension in y-direction of the image in pixels.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngHeader.BitDepth
member.summary: Bit depth is a single-byte integer giving the number of bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel). Valid values are 1, 2, 4, 8, and 16, although not all values are allowed for all color types.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngHeader.ColorType
member.summary: Color type is a integer that describes the interpretation of the image data. Color type codes represent sums of the following values: 1 (palette used), 2 (color used), and 4 (alpha channel used).

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngHeader.CompressionMethod
member.summary: Indicates the method used to compress the image data. At present, only compression method 0 (deflate/inflate compression with a sliding window of at most 32768 bytes) is defined.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngHeader.FilterMethod
member.summary: Indicates the preprocessing method applied to the image data before compression. At present, only filter method 0 (adaptive filtering with five basic filter types) is defined.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.PngHeader.InterlaceMethod
member.summary: Indicates the transmission order of the image data. Two values are currently defined: 0 (no interlace) or 1 (Adam7 interlace).

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.IO.Png.TrueColorReader
member.summary: Color reader for reading truecolors from a PNG file. Only colors with 24 or 32 bit (3 or 4 bytes) per pixel are supported at the moment.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLineAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of a text string relative to its layout rectangle

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLineAlignment.Near
member.summary: Specifies the text be aligned near the layout. In a left-to-right layout, the near position is left. In a right-to-left layout, the near position is right.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLineAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned in the center of the layout rectangle.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLineAlignment.Far
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned far from the origin position of the layout rectangle. In a left-to-right layout, the far position is right. In a right-to-left layout, the far position is left.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLineAlignment.BaseLine
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned relative to its base line. With this option the layout rectangle must have a height of 0.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode
member.summary: Specifies the direction of a linear gradient.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.Horizontal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from left to right.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.Vertical
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from top to bottom.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.ForwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from upper left to lower right.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.BackwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from upper right to lower left.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLineCap
member.summary: Specifies the available cap styles with which an XPen object can start and end a line.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLineCap.Flat
member.summary: Specifies a flat line cap.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLineCap.Round
member.summary: Specifies a round line cap.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLineCap.Square
member.summary: Specifies a square line cap.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLineJoin
member.summary: Specifies how to join consecutive line or curve segments in a figure or subpath.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLineJoin.Miter
member.summary: Specifies a mitered join. This produces a sharp corner or a clipped corner, depending on whether the length of the miter exceeds the miter limit

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLineJoin.Round
member.summary: Specifies a circular join. This produces a smooth, circular arc between the lines.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XLineJoin.Bevel
member.summary: Specifies a beveled join. This produces a diagonal corner.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XMatrixOrder
member.summary: Specifies the order for matrix transform operations.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XMatrixOrder.Prepend
member.summary: The new operation is applied before the old operation.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XMatrixOrder.Append
member.summary: The new operation is applied after the old operation.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XPageDirection
member.summary: Specifies the direction of the y-axis.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XPageDirection.Downwards
member.summary: Increasing Y values go downwards. This is the default.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XPageDirection.Upwards
member.summary: Increasing Y values go upwards. This is only possible when drawing on a PDF page. It is not implemented when drawing on a System.Drawing.Graphics object.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XSmoothingMode
member.summary: Specifies whether smoothing (or antialiasing) is applied to lines and curves and the edges of filled areas.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.Invalid
member.summary: Specifies an invalid mode.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.Default
member.summary: Specifies the default mode.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.HighSpeed
member.summary: Specifies high speed, low quality rendering.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.HighQuality
member.summary: Specifies high quality, low speed rendering.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.None
member.summary: Specifies no antialiasing.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.AntiAlias
member.summary: Specifies antialiased rendering.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XStringAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of a text string relative to its layout rectangle.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XStringAlignment.Near
member.summary: Specifies the text be aligned near the layout. In a left-to-right layout, the near position is left. In a right-to-left layout, the near position is right.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XStringAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned in the center of the layout rectangle.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XStringAlignment.Far
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned far from the origin position of the layout rectangle. In a left-to-right layout, the far position is right. In a right-to-left layout, the far position is left.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor
member.summary: Represents a RGB, CMYK, or gray scale color.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from a 32-bit ARGB value.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from a 32-bit ARGB value.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified 8-bit color values (red, green, and blue). The alpha value is implicitly 255 (fully opaque).

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the four ARGB component (alpha, red, green, and blue) values.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified System.Drawing.Color.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32,ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified alpha value and color.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified alpha value and color.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.FromCmyk(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified CMYK values.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.FromCmyk(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified CMYK values.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.FromGrayScale(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified gray value.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.FromKnownColor(ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XKnownColor)
member.summary: Creates an XColor from the specified pre-defined color.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.FromName(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an XColor from the specified name of a pre-defined color.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.ToWpfColor
member.summary: Creates a System.Windows.Media.Color object from this color.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is a Color structure and is equivalent to this Color structure.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.op_Equality(ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor,ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor)
member.summary: Determines whether two colors are equal.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.op_Inequality(ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor,ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor)
member.summary: Determines whether two colors are not equal.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.GetHue
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) hue value, in degrees, for this color.
member.returns: The hue, in degrees, of this color. The hue is measured in degrees, ranging from 0 through 360, in HSB color space.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.GetSaturation
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) saturation value for this color.
member.returns: The saturation of this color. The saturation ranges from 0 through 1, where 0 is grayscale and 1 is the most saturated.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.GetBrightness
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) brightness value for this color.
member.returns: The brightness of this color. The brightness ranges from 0 through 1, where 0 represents black and 1 represents white.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.RgbChanged
member.summary: One of the RGB values changed; recalculate other color representations.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XColor.CmykChanged
member.summary: One of the CMYK values changed; recalculate other color representations.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XPdfForm
member.summary: Represents a so called 'PDF form external object', which is typically an imported page of an external PDF document. XPdfForm objects are used like images to draw an existing PDF page of an external document in the current document. XPdfForm objects can only be placed in PDF documents. If you try to draw them using a XGraphics based on an GDI+ context no action is taken if no placeholder image is specified. Otherwise the place holder is drawn.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XPdfForm.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the XPdfForm class from the specified path to an external PDF document. Although PDFsharp internally caches XPdfForm objects it is recommended to reuse PdfXFrom objects in your code and change the PageNumber property if more than one page is needed form the external document. Furthermore, because XPdfForm can occupy very much memory, it is recommended to dispose XPdfForm objects if not needed anymore.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XPdfForm.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a stream.

member.summary: Creates an XPdfForm from a file.

member.summary: Creates an XPdfForm from a stream.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XPdfForm.Finish
member.summary: Sets the form in the state FormState.Finished.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XPdfForm.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: TODO: Frees the memory occupied by the underlying imported PDF document, even if other XPdfForm objects refer to this document. A reuse of this object doesnt fail, because the underlying PDF document is re-imported if neccessary. NYI

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XPdfForm.ExtractPageNumber(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Extracts the page number if the path has the form 'MyFile.pdf#123' and returns the actual path without the number sign and the following digits.

member.name: P:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XPdfForm.PlaceHolder
member.summary: Gets or sets an image that is used for drawing if the current XGraphics object cannot handle PDF forms. A place holder is useful for showing a preview of a page on the display, because PDFsharp cannot render native PDF objects.

member.name: P:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Drawing.XPdfForm.PageNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the page number in the external PDF document this object refers to. The page number is one-based, i.e. it is in the range from 1 to PageCount. The default value is 1.

member.summary: This table defines the mapping of character codes to the glyph index values used in the font. It may contain more than one subtable, in order to support more than one character encoding scheme.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Fonts.TrueType.CMapTable.#ctor(ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Fonts.TrueType.FontData)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Fonts.TrueType.FontHeaderTable
member.summary: This table gives global information about the font. The bounding box values should be computed using only glyphs that have contours. Glyphs with no contours should be ignored for the purposes of these calculations.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Fonts.TrueType.HorizontalHeaderTable
member.summary: This table contains information for horizontal layout. The values in the minRightSidebearing, minLeftSideBearing and xMaxExtent should be computed using only glyphs that have contours. Glyphs with no contours should be ignored for the purposes of these calculations. All reserved areas must be set to 0.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Fonts.TrueType.HorizontalMetricsTable
member.summary: The type longHorMetric is defined as an array where each element has two parts: the advance width, which is of type USHORT, and the left side bearing, which is of type SHORT. These fields are in font design units.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Fonts.TrueType.MaximumProfileTable
member.summary: This table establishes the memory requirements for this font. Fonts with CFF data must use Version 0.5 of this table, specifying only the numGlyphs field. Fonts with TrueType outlines must use Version 1.0 of this table, where all data is required. Both formats of OpenType require a 'maxp' table because a number of applications call the Windows GetFontData() API on the 'maxp' table to determine the number of glyphs in the font.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Fonts.TrueType.NameTable
member.summary:
The naming table allows multilingual strings to be associated with the OpenTypeTM font file. These strings can represent copyright notices, font names, family names, style names, and so on. To keep this table short, the font manufacturer may wish to make a limited set of entries in some small set of languages; later, the font can be "localized" and the strings translated or added. Other parts of the OpenType font file that require these strings can then refer to them simply by their index number. Clients that need a particular string can look it up by its platform ID, character encoding ID, language ID and name ID. Note that some platforms may require single byte character strings, while others may require double byte strings.
For historical reasons, some applications which install fonts perform version control using Macintosh platform (platform ID 1) strings from the 'name' table. Because of this, we strongly recommend that the 'name' table of all fonts include Macintosh platform strings and that the syntax of the version number (name id 5) follows the guidelines given in this document.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Fonts.TrueType.OS2Table
member.summary: The OS/2 table consists of a set of metrics that are required in OpenType fonts.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Fonts.TrueType.PostScriptTable
member.summary: This table contains additional information needed to use TrueType or OpenTypeTM fonts on PostScript printers.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Fonts.TrueType.ControlValueTable
member.summary: This table contains a list of values that can be referenced by instructions. They can be used, among other things, to control characteristics for different glyphs. The length of the table must be an integral number of FWORD units.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Fonts.TrueType.FontProgram
member.summary: This table is similar to the CVT Program, except that it is only run once, when the font is first used. It is used only for FDEFs and IDEFs. Thus the CVT Program need not contain function definitions. However, the CVT Program may redefine existing FDEFs or IDEFs.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Fonts.TrueType.ControlValueProgram
member.summary: The Control Value Program consists of a set of TrueType instructions that will be executed whenever the font or point size or transformation matrix change and before each glyph is interpreted. Any instruction is legal in the CVT Program but since no glyph is associated with it, instructions intended to move points within a particula glyph outline cannot be used in the CVT Program. The name 'prep' is anachronistic.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Fonts.TrueType.GlyphSubstitutionTable
member.summary: This table contains information that describes the glyphs in the font in the TrueType outline format. Information regarding the rasterizer (scaler) refers to the TrueType rasterizer.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags
member.summary: Specified the flags of AcroForm fields.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: If set, the user may not change the value of the field. Any associated widget annotations will not interact with the user; that is, they will not respond to mouse clicks or change their appearance in response to mouse motions. This flag is useful for fields whose values are computed or imported from a database.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Required
member.summary: If set, the field must have a value at the time it is exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.NoExport
member.summary: If set, the field must not be exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Pushbutton
member.summary: If set, the field is a pushbutton that does not retain a permanent value.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Radio
member.summary: If set, the field is a set of radio buttons; if clear, the field is a checkbox. This flag is meaningful only if the Pushbutton flag is clear.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.NoToggleToOff
F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Multiline
member.summary: If set, the field may contain multiple lines of text; if clear, the field�s text is restricted to a single line.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Password
member.summary: If set, the field is intended for entering a secure password that should not be echoed visibly to the screen. Characters typed from the keyboard should instead be echoed in some unreadable form, such as asterisks or bullet characters. To protect password confidentiality, viewer applications should never store the value of the text field in the PDF file if this flag is set.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.FileSelect
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the text entered in the field represents the pathname of a file whose contents are to be submitted as the value of the field.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.DoNotSpellCheckTextField
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the text entered in the field will not be spell-checked.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.DoNotScroll
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the field will not scroll (horizontally for single-line fields, vertically for multiple-line fields) to accommodate more text than will fit within its annotation rectangle. Once the field is full, no further text will be accepted.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Combo
member.summary: If set, the field is a combo box; if clear, the field is a list box.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Edit
F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Sort
member.summary: If set, the field�s option items should be sorted alphabetically. This flag is intended for use by form authoring tools, not by PDF viewer applications; viewers should simply display the options in the order in which they occur in the Opt array.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.MultiSelect
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, more than one of the field�s option items may be selected simultaneously; if clear, no more than one item at a time may be selected.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.DoNotSpellCheckChoiseField
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the text entered in the field will not be spell-checked. This flag is meaningful only if the Combo and Edit flags are both set.

member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary. The description comes from PDF 1.4 Reference.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.FT
member.summary: (Required for terminal fields; inheritable) The type of field that this dictionary describes: Btn Button Tx Text Ch Choice Sig (PDF 1.3) Signature Note: This entry may be present in a nonterminal field (one whose descendants are themselves fields) in order to provide an inheritable FT value. However, a nonterminal field does not logically have a type of its own; it is merely a container for inheritable attributes that are intended for descendant terminal fields of any type.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Parent
member.summary: (Required if this field is the child of another in the field hierarchy; absent otherwise) The field that is the immediate parent of this one (the field, if any, whose Kids array includes this field). A field can have at most one parent; that is, it can be included in the Kids array of at most one other field.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Kids
member.summary: (Optional) An array of indirect references to the immediate children of this field.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.T
member.summary: (Optional) The partial field name.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.TU
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) An alternate field name, to be used in place of the actual field name wherever the field must be identified in the user interface (such as in error or status messages referring to the field). This text is also useful when extracting the document�s contents in support of accessibility to disabled users or for other purposes.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.TM
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The mapping name to be used when exporting interactive form field data from the document.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Ff
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) A set of flags specifying various characteristics of the field. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.V
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) The field�s value, whose format varies depending on the field type; see the descriptions of individual field types for further information.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.DV
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) The default value to which the field reverts when a reset-form action is executed. The format of this value is the same as that of V.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.AA
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) An additional-actions dictionary defining the field�s behavior in response to various trigger events. This entry has exactly the same meaning as the AA entry in an annotation dictionary.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.DR
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) A resource dictionary containing default resources (such as fonts, patterns, or color spaces) to be used by the appearance stream. At a minimum, this dictionary must contain a Font entry specifying the resource name and font dictionary of the default font for displaying the field�s text.

member.summary: (Required; inheritable) The default appearance string, containing a sequence of valid page-content graphics or text state operators defining such properties as the field�s text size and color.

member.summary: (Required; inheritable) An array of options to be presented to the user. Each element of the array is either a text string representing one of the available options or a two-element array consisting of a text string together with a default appearance string for constructing the item�s appearance dynamically at viewing time.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfChoiseField.Keys.TI
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) For scrollable list boxes, the top index (the index in the Opt array of the first option visible in the list).

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfChoiseField.Keys.I
member.summary: (Sometimes required, otherwise optional; inheritable; PDF 1.4) For choice fields that allow multiple selection (MultiSelect flag set), an array of integers, sorted in ascending order, representing the zero-based indices in the Opt array of the currently selected option items. This entry is required when two or more elements in the Opt array have different names but the same export value, or when the value of the choice field is an array; in other cases, it is permitted but not required. If the items identified by this entry differ from those in the V entry of the field dictionary (see below), the V entry takes precedence.

This entry enables a PDF producer application to update the version using an incremental update.

member.summary: (Required; must be an indirect reference) The page tree node that is the root of the document�s page tree.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.PageLabels
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A number tree defining the page labeling for the document. The keys in this tree are page indices; the corresponding values are page label dictionaries. Each page index denotes the first page in a labeling range to which the specified page label dictionary applies. The tree must include a value for pageindex 0.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Names
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) The document�s name dictionary.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Dests
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1; must be an indirect reference) A dictionary of names and corresponding destinations.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.ViewerPreferences
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) A viewer preferences dictionary specifying the way the document is to be displayed on the screen. If this entry is absent, applications should use their own current user preference settings.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.PageLayout
member.summary: (Optional) A name object specifying the page layout to be used when the document is opened: SinglePage - Display one page at a time. OneColumn - Display the pages in one column. TwoColumnLeft - Display the pages in two columns, with oddnumbered pages on the left. TwoColumnRight - Display the pages in two columns, with oddnumbered pages on the right. TwoPageLeft - (PDF 1.5) Display the pages two at a time, with odd-numbered pages on the left TwoPageRight - (PDF 1.5) Display the pages two at a time, with odd-numbered pages on the right.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.PageMode
member.summary: (Optional) A name object specifying how the document should be displayed when opened: UseNone - Neither document outline nor thumbnail images visible. UseOutlines - Document outline visible. UseThumbs - Thumbnail images visible. FullScreen - Full-screen mode, with no menu bar, windowcontrols, or any other window visible. UseOC - (PDF 1.5) Optional content group panel visible. UseAttachments (PDF 1.6) Attachments panel visible. Default value: UseNone.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Outlines
member.summary: (Optional; must be an indirect reference) The outline dictionary that is the root of the document�s outline hierarchy.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Threads
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1; must be an indirect reference) An array of thread dictionaries representing the document�s article threads.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.OpenAction
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) A value specifying a destination to be displayed or an action to be performed when the document is opened. The value is either an array defining a destination or an action dictionary representing an action. If this entry is absent, the document should be opened to the top of the first page at the default magnification factor.

member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be Font for a CIDFont dictionary.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.Subtype
member.summary: (Required) The type of CIDFont; CIDFontType0 or CIDFontType2.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.BaseFont
member.summary: (Required) The PostScript name of the CIDFont. For Type 0 CIDFonts, this is usually the value of the CIDFontName entry in the CIDFont program. For Type 2 CIDFonts, it is derived the same way as for a simple TrueType font; In either case, the name can have a subset prefix if appropriate.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.CIDSystemInfo
member.summary: (Required) A dictionary containing entries that define the character collection of the CIDFont.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.FontDescriptor
member.summary: (Required; must be an indirect reference) A font descriptor describing the CIDFont’s default metrics other than its glyph widths.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.DW
member.summary: (Optional) The default width for glyphs in the CIDFont. Default value: 1000.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.W
member.summary: (Optional) A description of the widths for the glyphs in the CIDFont. The array’s elements have a variable format that can specify individual widths for consecutive CIDs or one width for a range of CIDs. Default value: none (the DW value is used for all glyphs).

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.DW2
member.summary: (Optional; applies only to CIDFonts used for vertical writing) An array of two numbers specifying the default metrics for vertical writing. Default value: [880 −1000].

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.W2
member.summary: (Optional; applies only to CIDFonts used for vertical writing) A description of the metrics for vertical writing for the glyphs in the CIDFont. Default value: none (the DW2 value is used for all glyphs).

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.CIDToGIDMap
member.summary: (Optional; Type 2 CIDFonts only) A specification of the mapping from CIDs to glyph indices. If the value is a stream, the bytes in the stream contain the mapping from CIDs to glyph indices: the glyph index for a particular CID value c is a 2-byte value stored in bytes 2 × c and 2 × c + 1, where the first byte is the high-order byte. If the value of CIDToGIDMap is a name, it must be Identity, indicating that the mapping between CIDs and glyph indices is the identity mapping. Default value: Identity. This entry may appear only in a Type 2 CIDFont whose associated True-Type font program is embedded in the PDF file.

member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The line width (see �Line Width� on page 185).

member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The miter limit.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.D
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The line dash pattern, expressed as an array of the form [dashArray dashPhase], where dashArray is itself an array and dashPhase is an integer.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.RI
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The name of the rendering intent.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.OP
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to apply overprint. In PDF 1.2 and earlier, there is a single overprint parameter that applies to all painting operations. Beginning with PDF 1.3, there are two separate overprint parameters: one for stroking and one for all other painting operations. Specifying an OP entry sets both parameters unless there is also an op entry in the same graphics state parameter dictionary, in which case the OP entry sets only the overprint parameter for stroking.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.op
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A flag specifying whether to apply overprint for painting operations other than stroking. If this entry is absent, the OP entry, if any, sets this parameter.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.OPM
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The overprint mode.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.Font
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) An array of the form [font size], where font is an indirect reference to a font dictionary and size is a number expressed in text space units. These two objects correspond to the operands of the Tf operator; however, the first operand is an indirect object reference instead of a resource name.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.BG
member.summary: (Optional) The black-generation function, which maps the interval [0.0 1.0] to the interval [0.0 1.0].

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.BG2
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) Same as BG except that the value may also be the name Default, denoting the black-generation function that was in effect at the start of the page. If both BG and BG2 are present in the same graphics state parameter dictionary, BG2 takes precedence.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.UCR
member.summary: (Optional) The undercolor-removal function, which maps the interval [0.0 1.0] to the interval [-1.0 1.0].

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.UCR2
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) Same as UCR except that the value may also be the name Default, denoting the undercolor-removal function that was in effect at the start of the page. If both UCR and UCR2 are present in the same graphics state parameter dictionary, UCR2 takes precedence.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.SA
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to apply automatic stroke adjustment.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.BM
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The current blend mode to be used in the transparent imaging model.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.SMask
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The current soft mask, specifying the mask shape or mask opacity values to be used in the transparent imaging model.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.CA
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The current stroking alpha constant, specifying the constant shape or constant opacity value to be used for stroking operations in the transparent imaging model.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.ca
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) Same as CA, but for nonstroking operations.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.AIS
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The alpha source flag (�alpha is shape�), specifying whether the current soft mask and alpha constant are to be interpreted as shape values (true) or opacity values (false).

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.TK

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags
member.summary: The PDF font descriptor flags.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.FixedPitch
member.summary: All glyphs have the same width (as opposed to proportional or variable-pitch fonts, which have different widths).

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Serif
member.summary: Glyphs have serifs, which are short strokes drawn at an angle on the top and bottom of glyph stems. (Sans serif fonts do not have serifs.)

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Symbolic
member.summary: Font contains glyphs outside the Adobe standard Latin character set. This flag and the Nonsymbolic flag cannot both be set or both be clear.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Script
member.summary: Glyphs resemble cursive handwriting.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Nonsymbolic
member.summary: Font uses the Adobe standard Latin character set or a subset of it.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Italic
member.summary: Glyphs have dominant vertical strokes that are slanted.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.AllCap
member.summary: Font contains no lowercase letters; typically used for display purposes, such as for titles or headlines.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.SmallCap
member.summary: Font contains both uppercase and lowercase letters. The uppercase letters are similar to those in the regular version of the same typeface family. The glyphs for the lowercase letters have the same shapes as the corresponding uppercase letters, but they are sized and their proportions adjusted so that they have the same size and stroke weight as lowercase glyphs in the same typeface family.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.ForceBold
member.summary: Determines whether bold glyphs are painted with extra pixels even at very small text sizes.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor
member.summary: A PDF font descriptor specifies metrics and other attributes of a simple font, as distinct from the metrics of individual glyphs.

member.name: P:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.FontName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the font.

member.name: P:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.IsSymbolFont
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is symbol font.

member.name: P:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta of this dictionary type.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be FontDescriptor for a font descriptor.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontName
member.summary: (Required) The PostScript name of the font. This name should be the same as the value of BaseFont in the font or CIDFont dictionary that refers to this font descriptor.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFamily
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5; strongly recommended for Type 3 fonts in Tagged PDF documents) A string specifying the preferred font family name. For example, for the font Times Bold Italic, the FontFamily is Times.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontStretch
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5; strongly recommended for Type 3 fonts in Tagged PDF documents) The font stretch value. It must be one of the following names (ordered from narrowest to widest): UltraCondensed, ExtraCondensed, Condensed, SemiCondensed, Normal, SemiExpanded, Expanded, ExtraExpanded or UltraExpanded. Note: The specific interpretation of these values varies from font to font. For example, Condensed in one font may appear most similar to Normal in another.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontWeight
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5; strongly recommended for Type 3 fonts in Tagged PDF documents) The weight (thickness) component of the fully-qualified font name or font specifier. The possible values are 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, or 900, where each number indicates a weight that is at least as dark as its predecessor. A value of 400 indicates a normal weight; 700 indicates bold. Note: The specific interpretation of these values varies from font to font. For example, 300 in one font may appear most similar to 500 in another.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Flags
member.summary: (Required) A collection of flags defining various characteristics of the font.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontBBox
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) A rectangle (see Section 3.8.4, �Rectangles�), expressed in the glyph coordinate system, specifying the font bounding box. This is the smallest rectangle enclosing the shape that would result if all of the glyphs of the font were placed with their origins coincident and then filled.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.ItalicAngle
member.summary: (Required) The angle, expressed in degrees counterclockwise from the vertical, of the dominant vertical strokes of the font. (For example, the 9-o�clock position is 90 degrees, and the 3-o�clock position is �90 degrees.) The value is negative for fonts that slope to the right, as almost all italic fonts do.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Ascent
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) The maximum height above the baseline reached by glyphs in this font, excluding the height of glyphs for accented characters.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Descent
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) The maximum depth below the baseline reached by glyphs in this font. The value is a negative number.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Leading
member.summary: (Optional) The spacing between baselines of consecutive lines of text. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.CapHeight
member.summary: (Required for fonts that have Latin characters, except for Type 3 fonts) The vertical coordinate of the top of flat capital letters, measured from the baseline.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.XHeight
member.summary: (Optional) The font�s x height: the vertical coordinate of the top of flat nonascending lowercase letters (like the letter x), measured from the baseline, in fonts that have Latin characters. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.StemV
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) The thickness, measured horizontally, of the dominant vertical stems of glyphs in the font.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.StemH
member.summary: (Optional) The thickness, measured vertically, of the dominant horizontal stems of glyphs in the font. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.AvgWidth
member.summary: (Optional) The average width of glyphs in the font. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.MaxWidth
member.summary: (Optional) The maximum width of glyphs in the font. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.MissingWidth
member.summary: (Optional) The width to use for character codes whose widths are not specified in a font dictionary�s Widths array. This has a predictable effect only if all such codes map to glyphs whose actual widths are the same as the value of the MissingWidth entry. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFile
member.summary: (Optional) A stream containing a Type 1 font program.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFile2
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) A stream containing a TrueType font program.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFile3
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) A stream containing a font program whose format is specified by the Subtype entry in the stream dictionary.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.CharSet
member.summary: (Optional; meaningful only in Type 1 fonts; PDF 1.1) A string listing the character names defined in a font subset. The names in this string must be in PDF syntax�that is, each name preceded by a slash (/). The names can appear in any order. The name .notdef should be omitted; it is assumed to exist in the font subset. If this entry is absent, the only indication of a font subset is the subset tag in the FontName entry.

member.summary: (Required) An array of four numbers in the form coordinate system, giving the coordinates of the left, bottom, right, and top edges, respectively, of the form XObject�s bounding box. These boundaries are used to clip the form XObject and to determine its size for caching.

member.summary: (Optional) An array of six numbers specifying the form matrix, which maps form space into user space. Default value: the identity matrix [1 0 0 1 0 0].

member.summary: Gets the underlying XImage object.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys
member.summary: Common keys for all streams.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be XObject for an image XObject.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.Subtype
member.summary: (Required) The type of XObject that this dictionary describes; must be Image for an image XObject.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.Width
member.summary: (Required) The width of the image, in samples.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.Height
member.summary: (Required) The height of the image, in samples.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.ColorSpace
member.summary: (Required for images, except those that use the JPXDecode filter; not allowed for image masks) The color space in which image samples are specified; it can be any type of color space except Pattern. If the image uses the JPXDecode filter, this entry is optional: � If ColorSpace is present, any color space specifications in the JPEG2000 data are ignored. � If ColorSpace is absent, the color space specifications in the JPEG2000 data are used. The Decode array is also ignored unless ImageMask is true.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.BitsPerComponent
member.summary: (Required except for image masks and images that use the JPXDecode filter) The number of bits used to represent each color component. Only a single value may be specified; the number of bits is the same for all color components. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, 8, and (in PDF 1.5) 16. If ImageMask is true, this entry is optional, and if specified, its value must be 1. If the image stream uses a filter, the value of BitsPerComponent must be consistent with the size of the data samples that the filter delivers. In particular, a CCITTFaxDecode or JBIG2Decode filter always delivers 1-bit samples, a RunLengthDecode or DCTDecode filter delivers 8-bit samples, and an LZWDecode or FlateDecode filter delivers samples of a specified size if a predictor function is used. If the image stream uses the JPXDecode filter, this entry is optional and ignored if present. The bit depth is determined in the process of decoding the JPEG2000 image.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.Intent
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) The name of a color rendering intent to be used in rendering the image. Default value: the current rendering intent in the graphics state.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.ImageMask
member.summary: (Optional) A flag indicating whether the image is to be treated as an image mask. If this flag is true, the value of BitsPerComponent must be 1 and Mask and ColorSpace should not be specified; unmasked areas are painted using the current nonstroking color. Default value: false.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.Mask
member.summary: (Optional except for image masks; not allowed for image masks; PDF 1.3) An image XObject defining an image mask to be applied to this image, or an array specifying a range of colors to be applied to it as a color key mask. If ImageMask is true, this entry must not be present.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.Decode
member.summary: (Optional) An array of numbers describing how to map image samples into the range of values appropriate for the image�s color space. If ImageMask is true, the array must be either [0 1] or [1 0]; otherwise, its length must be twice the number of color components required by ColorSpace. If the image uses the JPXDecode filter and ImageMask is false, Decode is ignored. Default value: see �Decode Arrays�.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.Interpolate
member.summary: (Optional) A flag indicating whether image interpolation is to be performed. Default value: false.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.Alternates
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) An array of alternate image dictionaries for this image. The order of elements within the array has no significance. This entry may not be present in an image XObject that is itself an alternate image.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.SMask
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A subsidiary image XObject defining a soft-mask image to be used as a source of mask shape or mask opacity values in the transparent imaging model. The alpha source parameter in the graphics state determines whether the mask values are interpreted as shape or opacity. If present, this entry overrides the current soft mask in the graphics state, as well as the image�s Mask entry, if any. (However, the other transparencyrelated graphics state parameters�blend mode and alpha constant�remain in effect.) If SMask is absent, the image has no associated soft mask (although the current soft mask in the graphics state may still apply).

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.SMaskInData
member.summary: (Optional for images that use the JPXDecode filter, meaningless otherwise; PDF 1.5) A code specifying how soft-mask information encoded with image samples should be used: 0 If present, encoded soft-mask image information should be ignored. 1 The image�s data stream includes encoded soft-mask values. An application can create a soft-mask image from the information to be used as a source of mask shape or mask opacity in the transparency imaging model. 2 The image�s data stream includes color channels that have been preblended with a background; the image data also includes an opacity channel. An application can create a soft-mask image with a Matte entry from the opacity channel information to be used as a source of mask shape or mask opacity in the transparency model. If this entry has a nonzero value, SMask should not be specified. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.Name
member.summary: (Required in PDF 1.0; optional otherwise) The name by which this image XObject is referenced in the XObject subdictionary of the current resource dictionary.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.StructParent
member.summary: (Required if the image is a structural content item; PDF 1.3) The integer key of the image�s entry in the structural parent tree.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.ID
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3; indirect reference preferred) The digital identifier of the image�s parent Web Capture content set.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.OPI
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) An OPI version dictionary for the image. If ImageMask is true, this entry is ignored.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.Metadata
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A metadata stream containing metadata for the image.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.Export.PDF.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage2.Keys.OC
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) An optional content group or optional content membership dictionary, specifying the optional content properties for this image XObject. Before the image is processed, its visibility is determined based on this entry. If it is determined to be invisible, the entire image is skipped, as if there were no Do operator to invoke it.
